name: GetAudienceMergeFields
description:
Get a list of all merge fields for an audience.

Use this tool to retrieve all the merge fields associated with a specific audience in Mailchimp. This is useful for understanding the structure and data fields available within an audience.

parameters.name: audience_list_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the audience list in Mailchimp.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the list.

parameters.name: fields_to_return
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of fields to return, using dot notation for sub-objects.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to return. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: exclude_fields_list
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude from the response. Use dot notation for sub-object fields.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of fields to exclude. Reference parameters of sub-objects with dot notation.

parameters.name: number_of_records_to_return
parameters.description: Specify the number of records to return, between 1 and 1000 (default is 10).

value_schema.description: The number of records to return. Default value is 10. Maximum value is 1000

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: The number of records to skip for pagination. Default is 0.

value_schema.description: Used for [pagination](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/methods-parameters/#pagination), this is the number of records from a collection to skip. Default value is 0.

parameters.name: merge_field_type
parameters.description: Specify the type of merge field to retrieve, such as 'text', 'number', etc.

parameters.name: is_required_merge_field
parameters.description: Indicates if the merge field is required. Pass 'true' or 'false'.

value_schema.description: Whether it's a required merge field.
